issue.title: Global area, adding an image and constraining size gives error 500
issue.body:
### Affected Version of Concrete CMS

9.x

### Description

On atomik, in the footer at the global area 'Footer Column 1' if you add an image and constrain the height then the website doesnt reload, if you reload manually you get the following error: 

Whoops\Exception\ErrorException thrown with message "session_start(): Failed to decode session object. Session has been destroyed"

Stacktrace:
#21 Whoops\Exception\ErrorException in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/symfony/http-foundation/Session/Storage/NativeSessionStorage.php:185
#20 session_start in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/symfony/http-foundation/Session/Storage/NativeSessionStorage.php:185
#19 Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Session\Storage\NativeSessionStorage:start in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/symfony/http-foundation/Session/Storage/NativeSessionStorage.php:352
#18 Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Session\Storage\NativeSessionStorage:getBag in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/src/Session/Storage/LoggedStorage.php:248
#17 Concrete\Core\Session\Storage\LoggedStorage:getBag in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/symfony/http-foundation/Session/Session.php:261
#16 Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Session\Session:getBag in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/symfony/http-foundation/Session/Session.php:283
#15 Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Session\Session:getAttributeBag in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/symfony/http-foundation/Session/Session.php:69
#14 Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Session\Session:has in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/src/User/User.php:304
#13 Concrete\Core\User\User:__construct in [internal]:0
#12 ReflectionClass:newInstanceArgs in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/illuminate/container/Container.php:917
#11 Illuminate\Container\Container:build in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/src/Application/Application.php:445
#10 Concrete\Core\Application\Application:build in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/illuminate/container/Container.php:292
#9 Illuminate\Container\Container:Illuminate\Container\{closure} in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/illuminate/container/Container.php:873
#8 Illuminate\Container\Container:build in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/src/Application/Application.php:445
#7 Concrete\Core\Application\Application:build in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/illuminate/container/Container.php:758
#6 Illuminate\Container\Container:resolve in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/illuminate/container/Container.php:694
#5 Illuminate\Container\Container:make in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/src/Foundation/Runtime/Run/DefaultRunner.php:193
#4 Concrete\Core\Foundation\Runtime\Run\DefaultRunner:setSystemLocale in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/src/Foundation/Runtime/Run/DefaultRunner.php:329
#3 Concrete\Core\Foundation\Runtime\Run\DefaultRunner:trySteps in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/src/Foundation/Runtime/Run/DefaultRunner.php:80
#2 Concrete\Core\Foundation\Runtime\Run\DefaultRunner:run in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/src/Foundation/Runtime/DefaultRuntime.php:102
#1 Concrete\Core\Foundation\Runtime\DefaultRuntime:run in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/dispatcher.php:45
#0 require in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/index.php:2

after that it bricks your website with an error 500, only way i found to solve it is to remove the version directly in the database 

### How to reproduce

add image to footer global area, and constrain its max height.

### Possible Solution

not sure what causes this.

### Additional Context

Whoops\Exception\ErrorException thrown with message "session_start(): Failed to decode session object. Session has been destroyed"

Stacktrace:
#21 Whoops\Exception\ErrorException in /data/sites/web/kesseltbe/www/concrete/vendor/symfony/http-foundation/Session/Storage/NativeSessionStorage.php:185

comment.body:
Hello Sir,

From a maintainability standpoint, I initially thought that defining everything in one place would be easier. However, given that the if-statement on line 69 `if($scheduledVersionExists == false) {` is self-explanatory, I agree that it is probably a better idea to define the strings directly as you suggested. 

Is there anything else that could be optimized? Also, regarding the color code `#0099ff` in the `.svg-icon` class, is it defined somewhere within the project where I could reference it easily?

pull_request.title: Enhance Clarity of Version Scheduling Interface
pull_request.body:
This pull request endeavors to clarify the Version Scheduling feature by presenting clearer descriptions and info boxes to users. The modifications are aimed at ensuring a more intuitive user experience when scheduling versions for publication.

Technical Details: 
- Reorganized the logic to set descriptive texts and info messages based on whether a scheduled version exists or an active version exists.
- Introduced additional HTML structure to accommodate alternative texts and info messages.
- Added CSS styling for improved visibility and user interaction with the info boxes.

Screenshots:
![Bildschirmfoto 2023-10-27 um 08 22 00](https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/assets/107244530/e5413930-c53c-4036-a8e4-f1f757e0184e)

Additional Context:
This is my second pull request, inspired by feedback from clients using our Concrete CMS sites. The changes have been tested for consistency with the project's coding style guidelines by running the style fix.

repo.name: concretecms

comment.body:
Why do you define these variables? I'd instead simply write the strings where they are needed...
For example, instead of having:

```php
$activeVersionExistsText = t('At the moment, the existing live version will remain.');
$primaryText = $activeVersionExistsText;
```

I'd simply prefer

```php
$primaryText = t('At the moment, the existing live version will remain.');
```

Also, some of the translatable strings are missing `t()`.

issue.title: Errors in reCAPTCHA validation: invalid-input-response

labels.name: Type:Bug
labels.description: Existing functionality not performing as expected.

issue.body:
### Affected Version of Concrete CMS

8.5.x, 9.x

### Description

Same error message as #9798, but I found another reason.
It happens only when the website doesn't require jQuery.

### How to reproduce

Enable reCAPTCHA on the website that does not require jQuery.

### Possible Solution

1. Require jquery in RecaptchaV3Controller
2. Rewrite the script in RecaptchaV3Controller with VanillaJS

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue.body: ### Description Maybe call this Extensions? Packages? Something that doesn't include "concrete5" ### Example _No response_

comment.body:
@ccmEnlil it looks like v9 :)
I think the site was upgraded from v8. It looks like single page didn't get renamed while upgrade.

BTW, I like the idea. "Extend" could mean a lot.

Extensions sounds Joomla. Since Concrete is calling "it" as Package. It will vote for "Packages" or "Manage packages"

issue.title: v8 - Gettext uses deprecated array_key_exists() which throws a ConversionException on PHP 7.4

labels.name: Type:Bug
labels.description: Existing functionality not performing as expected.

labels.name: Bug Priority:Low
labels.description: This would be a nice fix, but it mildly improves things that already work.

labels.name: Bug:Level of Effort:Unknown
labels.description: Bugs where the level of effort to solve or even reproduce is unknown.

issue.body:
### Affected Version of Concrete CMS

8.5.x

### Description

Versions:

- PHP 7.4
- CMS 8.5.12
- concrete5/dependency-patches 1.6.1
- zendframework/zend-i18n 2.7.4

When setting up the express entities, no exceptions occurred also while adding new entries (already with PHP7.4). After 5 months an exception is thrown, when trying to access the entry pages of the express entities:
```
Doctrine \ DBAL \ Types \ 
ConversionException
Could not convert database value to 'object' as an error was triggered by the unserialization: 'array_key_exists(): Using array_key_exists() on objects is deprecated. Use isset() or property_exists() instead'
The code triggering this exception is here: …/vendor/zendframework/zend-i18n/src/Translator/Loader/Gettext.php142
```

This exception is thrown during the translation of entity fields.

### How to reproduce

This bug can only be reproduced in a multilingual setup. But in the end I don't know, how to reproduce. If you need this, please let me know.

### Possible Solution

Update `zendframework/zend-i18n`:
- old: `2.7.4`
- new `2.10.1`

### Additional Context

Forum entry: https://forums.concretecms.org/t/5-8-12-gettext-array-key-exists-conversionexception/6321

Fix coming soon.

issue.title: [Feature Request] Set order of the results of search block
issue.body:
### Description

Since version 8, we don't use `IndexedPageList` class for the search block.
That means the results of a search block are not sorted, the pages are listed as older first.

How about adding an option to change the order?
Otherwise, we may use `filterByFulltextKeywords()` method instead. The results will sorted by index score.

### Example

Here's the SQL of the search block. There's no ORDER clause:

```
SELECT p.cID FROM Pages p LEFT JOIN PageSearchIndex psi ON p.cID = psi.cID LEFT JOIN PageTypes pt ON p.ptID = pt.ptID INNER JOIN Collections c ON p.cID = c.cID INNER JOIN CollectionVersions cv ON p.cID = cv.cID LEFT JOIN CollectionSearchIndexAttributes csi ON c.cID = csi.cID WHERE ((psi.cName LIKE :keywords) OR (psi.cDescription LIKE :keywords) OR (psi.content LIKE :keywords) OR (ak_tags LIKE :keywords) OR (ak_exclude_subpages_from_nav LIKE :keywords) OR (ak_thumbnail LIKE :keywords) OR (ak_blog_entry_topics LIKE :keywords)) AND (ak_exclude_search_index <> 1 or ak_exclude_search_index is null) AND (p.cPointerID < 1) AND (p.cIsTemplate = 0) AND (cv.cvID = (select max(cvID) from CollectionVersions where cID = cv.cID and cvIsApproved = 1 and ((cvPublishDate <= :cvPublishDate or cvPublishDate is null) and (cvPublishEndDate >= :cvPublishDate or cvPublishEndDate is null)))) AND (p.cIsActive = :cIsActive) AND (p.siteTreeID = 1) AND (p.cIsSystemPage = 0) LIMIT 10
```

We have to move to CKeditor 5, but we should update to the recent CKEditor 4 before moving to the next major version.

https://ckeditor.com/cke4/release-notes

Related issues: #11347, #10519

_No response_
